sen.j: 雍州（ようしゅう）は、中国の歴史的な州の一つ。
sen.e: Yong Zhou was one of the historical provinces in China.

sen.j: 上古の中国の九州 (中国)の一つに数えられている。
sen.e: It was among Jiuzhou in China in ancient times.
It was among Jiuzhou (literally, The Nine Provinces) in China in ancient times.
sen.cmt: (literally, The Nine Provinces)を補足しました。

sen.j: 具体的な区域については、『爾雅』では「河西」、『尚書』では「黒水西河」とする。
sen.e: Specifically, the "Erya" defined the area as "Hexi" and the "Shosho" (Classic of History) as "Heishui Hexi (or, Heishui Xihe)".
sen.cmt: 2つの書とも、有名なようですので「the」をつけました。

sen.j: 黄河は陝西省と山西省の境界付近を南から北に流れている。
sen.e: The Yellow River flows from south to north near the border between Shan Xi Province and Shanxi Province.

sen.j: 「河西」「西河」はこの黄河の西側という意である。
sen.e: The "Hexi" and "Xihe" meant the west side of this Yellow River.

sen.j: 『周礼』では「正西」すなわち中原から真西側にあたる地域であるとする。
sen.e: "The Rites of Zhou" defined the area as "Zhengxi", that is, from the center of the field to the due west side.

sen.j: 漢の州名として雍州は使用されず、陝西省・甘粛省一帯は涼州とされた。
sen.e: The "Yong Zhou" was not used for the name of province in Han, instead, it was designated as Liang Zhou for the area of Shan Xi Province and Gansu Province.
During the time of han dynasty, the "Yong Zhou" was not used for the name of province, instead, it was designated as Liang Zhou for the area of Shan Xi Province and Gansu Province.
sen.cmt: in Hanでは明確でないと考えてHan dynastyとしました。
sen.e: During the time of han dynasty, the "Yong Zhou" was not used for the name of province, instead, it was designated as Liang Zhou for the area of Shan Xi Province and Gansu Province.

sen.j: しかし後漢の興平元年に甘粛省側の4郡を分割して雍州とし、陝西省側をそのまま涼州とした。
sen.e: In 194 of the Later Han Dynasty, however, four countries of Gansu Province side were separated and named Yong Zhou, while the Shan Xi Province was continuously called Liang Zhou.

sen.j: その後、建安18年に州名を古代の九州の通りに改めるとして、雍州・涼州を合併し雍州とした。
sen.e: Later, in 213 the names of the provinces were to be renamed as in ancient Jiuzhou, and Yong Zhou and Liang Zhou were merged into Yong Zhou.

sen.j: 黄初元年に今度は甘粛省側を分割して涼州として、陝西省側を雍州とした。
sen.e: Next, in 220, Gansu Province side was separated to be named Liang Zhou, while Shan Xi Province side was to be called Yong Zhou.

sen.j: つまり、わずか半世紀の間に涼州と雍州の領域がほぼ入れ替わるという珍妙な現象が起こったこととなる。
sen.e: That is, it resulted in a strange phenomenon that the area called Liang Zhou and the one called Yong Zhou had nearly been exchanged each other in only half a century.

sen.j: 曹丕の治世中に雍州西部を分割して秦州とした。
sen.e: During the reign of Cao Pi, the west of Yong Zhou was separated to Qin Zhou.
sen.cmt: 「曹丕」用語集に「Cao Pi」、「 Sohi」２つありました。前者を採用しました。
sen.e: During the reign of Cao Pi, the west of Yong Zhou was separated to Qin Zhou.

sen.j: In early Jin, Changan was established as 州治 (provincial capital).

sen.e: In early Jin, Changan was established as 州治 (provincial capital).
sen.cmt: 州治は、州内を管轄するところらしいので、provincial captalとしてみました。
sen.e: In early Jin, Changan was established as provincial capital.

sen.j: 北魏の太和11年にさらに雍州西部を分割して岐州とした。
sen.e: In 487 of Northern Wei, the west of Yong Zhou was further separated to Qi Zhou.

sen.j: 一方、太平真君4年に雍州とは別に山西省南部に「東雍州」が設けられたが、太和4年に廃された。
sen.e: In 443, on the other hand, independently from Yong Zhou, "east Yong Zhou" was established in the south of Shanxi Province, but it was abolished in 480.

sen.j: 南朝も東晋の大元年間に襄陽を中心とする地域に僑州として雍州を置いていた。
sen.e: From 376 to 396 of Eastern Jin Dynasty, Nan-Dynasty also establishd Yong Zhou as Qianzhou in the area surrounding Xiangyang.

sen.j: しかし、西魏の恭帝元年に北朝がこの地を占領すると、同じ北朝内に雍州を二つ置くわけにいかないため、襄州と改名した。
sen.e: While, in 554 of Westerm Wei, after this area was in occupation of Pei-Dynasty, it was renamed Xianzhou, because two Yong Zhou could not exist in the same Pei-Dynasty.

sen.j: 北周・隋・唐代には雍州は国都長安の所在する州であることから、長官は州刺史ではなく州牧とされ、品秩も刺史より上であった。
sen.e: In the time of Northern Zhou, Sui, and Tang dynasties, Yong Zhou was the state where Changan existed, accordingly its president was not Zhoucishi but Zhoumu, the title of the peerage and salary of which were higher than shishi (Provincial Governor).
sen.cmt: 「品秩｣→「a title of the peerage and salary」
sen.e: In the time of Northern Zhou, Sui, and Tang dynasties, Yong Zhou was the state where Changan, national capital existed, accordingly its president was not Zhoucishi but Zhoumu, the title of the peerage and salary of which were higher than shishi (Provincial Governor).
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ, national capitalを補足しました。

sen.j: また、軍事拠点として関内道の総監府が置かれた。
sen.e: Also, as a military base, the Headquarters of 関内道 was placed.

sen.j: 唐の開元元年に雍州は京兆府と改められ、州名としては消滅した。
sen.e: In 713 of Tang dynasty, Yong Zhou was disappeared as country name and renamed as Jingzhaofu.

sen.j: 長安を含む州であったため、それに倣って日本の京師である山城国の雅称に転用した。
sen.e: Since the province contained Changan, the name was used to sophisticatedly mean Japanese capital of Yamashiro Province.

sen.e: Since the province contained Changan, the name was used as the chic alias name for Japanese capital of Yamashiro Province.
